entry.title: [GRA5][Managed Kubernetes Service] - CAs c2.gra
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Feb 21, 13:00 - 17:00 UTC

Feb 14, 01:27 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 21/02/2024 13:00 UTC
End time : 21/02/2024 17:00 UTC
Service impact : None
Service improvement : Following our continuous improvement policy, we need to renew the CAs of the kubeadmin c2.gra. Since konnectivity release and because we need to redeploy cluster control plane, every cluster redeployed will be migrated to konnectivity feature

Thank you for your understanding.

entry.title: [Global][Managed Kubernetes Service] - rolling out an update
entry.content:
Jan 30, 09:48 UTC
Completed - Operations on this maintenance have been postponed to a later date.

Jan 25, 01:00 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 30/01/2024 10:00 UTC
End time : 01/02/2024 15:00 UTC
Service impact : None
Service improvement : Following our continuous improvement policy, we are rolling out an update.
All cluster with an "ALWAYS_UPDATE" policy will be updated.
This update will target the following components in each cluster:
- Main Kubernetes components
- Network Engine
- Storage controller
- Metrics server
- DNS server

entry.title: [SGP/SYD/WAW][Managed Kubernetes Service] - Network pertubation after configuration change
entry.content:
Jan 29, 15:07 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 29/01/2024 13:00 UTC
End time : 29/01/2024 14:40 UTC
Service impact : A configuration change (update version, desired node, ip restriction) applied on managed clusters and nodes running in SGP, WAW and SYD may have generated a network outage.
Root cause : Software malfunction
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

Jan 29, 14:41 UTC
Monitoring - Our technical teams implemented a fix in SGP, SYD and WAW.
We are currently monitoring the situation

Jan 29, 14:28 UTC
Update - Our teams implemented a fix for WAW region and are working on a fix for SYD and SGP.

Investigating - Start time : 29/01/2024 13:00 UTC
Service impact : A configuration change (update version, desired node, ip restriction) applied on managed clusters and nodes running in SGP, WAW and SYD will generate a network outage.
Ongoing actions : Investigating
Our technical teams are working on the issue. Update will be posted as significant progress is made.
